DataElement.preferredName: CTC Adverse Event Secondary Malignant Neoplasm Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: in CTC category Secondary Malignancy (excludes metastasis from initial primary), text description of an unlisted adverse event type.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: CTC Adverse Event Secondary Malignant Neoplasm
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the CTC adverse event of a secondary malignancy.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Property.preferredDefinition: Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer, and the tumor in the lungs is called a secondary tumor. Also called secondary tumor.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm that arises from a pre-existing lower grade lesion, or as a result of a primary lesion that has spread to secondary sites, or due to a complication of a cancer treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an adverse event.
